translations.text: Believers, do not advance before Allah and His Messenger,<sup foot_note="181513">1</sup> and fear Allah. Verily Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.<sup foot_note="181514">2</sup>

Believers, do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet and when speaking to him do not speak aloud as you speak aloud to one another,<sup foot_note="181515">1</sup> lest all your deeds are reduced to nothing without your even realising it.<sup foot_note="181516">2</sup>

The ones who lower their voices in the presence of the Messenger of Allah are those whose hearts Allah has tested for God-fearing.<sup foot_note="181517">1</sup> Theirs shall be forgiveness and a great reward.
Surely most of those who call out to you, (O Prophet), from behind the apartments, are devoid of understanding.
If they were patient until you went out to them, that would have been better for them.<sup foot_note="181518">1</sup> Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.<sup foot_note="181519">2</sup>

Believers, when an ungodly person brings to you a piece of news, carefully ascertain its truth, lest you should hurt a people unwittingly and thereafter repent at what you did.<sup foot_note="181520">1</sup>

Know that Allah's Messenger is among you. Were he to follow you in many an affair, you yourselves would suffer.<sup foot_note="181521">1</sup> But Allah has endeared faith to you and has embellished it in your hearts, and has made unbelief and evil-doing and disobedience abhorrent to you. Such are those who are rightly guided,
by Allah's favour and bounty.<sup foot_note="181522">1</sup> Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.<sup foot_note="181523">2</sup>

If two parties of the believers happen to fight,<sup foot_note="181524">1</sup> make peace between them.<sup foot_note="181525">2</sup> But then, if one of them transgresses against the other, fight the one that transgresses<sup foot_note="181526">3</sup> until it reverts to Allah's command.<sup foot_note="181527">4</sup> And if it does revert, make peace between them with justice,<sup foot_note="181528">5</sup> and be equitable for Allah loves the equitable.<sup foot_note="181529">6</sup>
Surely the believers are none but brothers unto one another, so set things right between your brothers,<sup foot_note="181530">1</sup> and have fear of Allah that you may be shown mercy.

Believers,<sup foot_note="181531">1</sup> let not a group (of men) scoff at another group, it may well be that the latter (at whom they scoff) are better than they;<sup foot_note="181532">2</sup> nor let a group of women scoff at another group, it may well be that the latter are better than they.<sup foot_note="181533">3</sup> And do not taunt one another,<sup foot_note="181534">4</sup> nor revile one another by nicknames.<sup foot_note="181535">5</sup> It is an evil thing to gain notoriety for ungodliness after belief.<sup foot_note="181536">6</sup> Those who do not repent are indeed the wrong-doers.

Believers, avoid being excessively suspicious, for some suspicion is a sin.<sup foot_note="181537">1</sup> Do not spy,<sup foot_note="181538">2</sup> nor backbite one another.<sup foot_note="181539">3</sup> Would any of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother?<sup foot_note="181540">4</sup> You would surely detest it. Have fear of Allah. Surely Allah is much prone to accept repentance, is Most Compassionate.

Human beings, We created you all from a male and a female, and made you into nations and tribes so that you may know one another. Verily the noblest of you in the sight of Allah is the most God-fearing of you.<sup foot_note="181541">1</sup> Surely Allah is All-Knowing, All-Aware.<sup foot_note="181542">2</sup>

The Bedouins say: “We believe.”(O Prophet),<sup foot_note="181543">1</sup> say to them: “You do not believe; you should rather say: 'We have submitted'”;<sup foot_note="181544">2</sup> for belief has not yet entered your hearts. If you obey Allah and His Messenger, He will not diminish anything from the reward of any of your deeds. Surely Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.

Indeed the ones possessed of true faith are those who believed in Allah and His Messenger and then they did not entertain any doubt and strove hard in the Way of Allah with their lives and their possessions. These are the truthful ones.
Say, (O Prophet), (to these pretenders to faith): “Are you apprising Allah of your faith? Allah knows all that is in the heavens and the earth. Allah has full knowledge of everything.”

They count it as a favour to you that they accepted Islam. Say: “Do not regard your (accepting) Islam as a favour to me; rather, Allah has bestowed a favour on you by guiding you to faith, if you are truthful (in your claim to be believers).
Surely Allah knows every hidden thing of the heavens and the earth. Allah sees all that you do.
